metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Node.js MySQL Insert Into
Insert Into Table
To fill a table in MySQL, use the "INSERT INTO" statement.
content.html: To fill a table in MySQL, use the "INSERT INTO" statement.

content.code_html:
var mysql = require('mysql');

var con = mysql.createConnection({
  host: "localhost",
  user: "yourusername",
  password: "yourpassword",
  database: "mydb"
});

con.connect(function(err) {
  if (err) throw err;
  console.log("Connected!");
  var sql = "INSERT INTO customers (name, address) VALUES ('Company Inc', 'Highway 37')";
  con.query(sql, function (err, result) {
    if (err) throw err;
    console.log("1 record inserted");
  });
});

content.text: Save the code above in a file called "demo_db_insert.js", and run the file:
content.html: Save the code above in a file called "demo_db_insert.js", and run the file:

content.code_html: C:\Users\Your Name>node demo_db_insert.js

content.text: Which will give you this result:

content.code_html:
Connected!
1 record inserted

content.text: Insert Multiple Records
To insert more than one record, make an array containing the values, and insert a question mark in the sql, which will be replaced by the value array: INSERT INTO customers (name, address) VALUES ?
content.html:
To insert more than one record, make an array containing the values, and insert a question mark in the sql, which will be replaced by the value array:
INSERT INTO customers (name, address) VALUES ?

content.code_html:
var mysql = require('mysql');

var con = mysql.createConnection({
  host: "localhost",
  user: "yourusername",
  password: "yourpassword",
  database: "mydb"
});

con.connect(function(err) {
  if (err) throw err;
  console.log("Connected!");
  var sql = "INSERT INTO customers (name, address) VALUES ?";
  var values = [
    ['John', 'Highway 71'],
    ['Peter', 'Lowstreet 4'],
    ['Amy', 'Apple st 652'],
    ['Hannah', 'Mountain 21'],
    ['Michael', 'Valley 345'],
    ['Sandy', 'Ocean blvd 2'],
    ['Betty', 'Green Grass 1'],
    ['Richard', 'Sky st 331'],
    ['Susan', 'One way 98'],
    ['Vicky', 'Yellow Garden 2'],
    ['Ben', 'Park Lane 38'],
    ['William', 'Central st 954'],
    ['Chuck', 'Main Road 989'],
    ['Viola', 'Sideway 1633']
  ];
  con.query(sql, [values], function (err, result) {
    if (err) throw err;
    console.log("Number of records inserted: " + result.affectedRows);
  });
});

content.text: Save the code above in a file called "demo_db_insert_multple.js", and run the file:
content.html: Save the code above in a file called "demo_db_insert_multple.js", and run the file:

content.code_html: C:\Users\Your Name>node demo_db_insert_multiple.js

content.text: Which will give you this result:

content.code_html:
Connected!
Number of records inserted: 14

content.text: The Result Object
When executing a query, a result object is returned.
content.html: When executing a query, a result object is returned.

content.text: The result object contains information about how the query affected the table.
content.html: The result object contains information about how the query affected the table.

content.text: The result object returned from the example above looks like this:
content.html: The result object returned from the example above looks like this:

syntaxHighlighting.text:

  serverStatus: 2,  warningCount: 0,  message: '\'Records:14  
  Duplicated: 0  Warnings: 0',  protocol41: true,  
  changedRows: 0}

content.html: The values of the properties can be displayed like this:

content.text: Which will produce this result:
Get Inserted ID
For tables with an auto increment id field, you can get the id of the row you just inserted by asking the result object.
content.html: For tables with an auto increment id field, you can get the id of the row you just inserted by asking the result object.

content.text: Note: To be able to get the inserted id, only one row can be inserted.
content.html: Note: To be able to get the inserted id, only one row can be inserted.

content.code_html:
var mysql = require('mysql');

var con = mysql.createConnection({
  host: "localhost",
  user: "yourusername",
  password: "yourpassword",
  database: "mydb"
});

con.connect(function(err) {
  if (err) throw err;
  var sql = "INSERT INTO customers (name, address) VALUES ('Michelle', 'Blue Village 1')";
  con.query(sql, function (err, result) {
    if (err) throw err;
    console.log("1 record inserted, ID: " + result.insertId);
  });
});

content.text: Save the code above in a file called "demo_db_insert_id.js", and run the file:
content.html: Save the code above in a file called "demo_db_insert_id.js", and run the file:

content.code_html: C:\Users\Your Name>node demo_db_insert_id.js

content.text: Which will give you something like this in return:
content.html: Which will give you something like this in return:

content.code_html: 1 record inserted, ID: 15
